title: Is my laptop not good enough?
body:
My laptop spec is gtx 950m 2GB DDR3 + i5 4210h  2.90GHz with 8GB Ram. 

In the early stages of the game, the fps stays from 100~130 with everything set to very low (w/ shadow turned off) at 1920x1080 res.

In the late game, the fps drops to around 80fps and then in heavy teamfights, it drops to somewhere between 50~60 fps, affecting my overall gameplay. 

I know this spec is just an entry level but shouldn't it still be able to run above 100fps with everything set to very low (with shadow turned off) at 1920x1080 rez? 

P.S I set my client to Low spec and checked the option to turn the client off during the game.

replies.body: Looking over the [**minimum specs page**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654), it looks like you should be alright with this setup. Let's make sure you've updated your graphics drivers too, as that can make some pretty big differences too. Check out the steps listed in our [**FPS guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) to cover some basic troubleshooting, check for any driver updates, and let me know if that helps.

Check out the steps listed in our [**FPS guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) to cover some basic troubleshooting, check for any driver updates, and let me know if that helps.

I tried those and same thing still happens.

May I also add that your Power options can (not always) affect your FPS problems. Ensure you've tried playing with both Balanced and High Performance. If one of those gives you your FPS back then it may be a battery problem. I've had the fps drop lots even without teamfights and my problem was my battery being bad, and setting it to balanced fixed my problem. 

That may be the cause of your fps drops.
